Name: GARDE
Unique Factor: Designed for use within EHR systems
Summary?: GARDE (Genetic Cancer Risk Detector) is a population clinical decision support (CDS) platform based on Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) and CDS Hooks standards. GARDE (i) screens and identifies patients who meet National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) criteria for evaluation of familial cancer risk based on their family history in the EHR; and (ii) promotes genetic testing with eligible patients through a rule-based conversational agent (chatbot) that minimizes genetic counseling workload by automating patient outreach and education. GARDE has been integrated with two market-leading EHR systems (EpicÂ® and CernerÂ®). GARDE is open source software that can be deployed both through containerization and cloud-based services. GARDE has been deployed in clinical settings at two academic medical centers and their respective cancer centers (University of Utah Health/Huntsman Cancer Institute and New York University Langone Health) in support of the BRIDGE trial, funded by NCIâ€™s Cancer Moonshot program.

Name: Text Information Extraction System (TIES)
Unique Factor: Extracts information from Surgical Pathology Reports;
Summary?: TIES is a service based software system for acquiring, deidentifying, and processing clinical text reports using natural language processing, and also for querying, sharing and using this data to foster tissue and image based research, within and between institutions.

Name: Fets
Unique Factor: This open-source platform offers more advanced researchers an opportunity to work with pre-trained segmentation models of deep learning algorithms for easy analysis of radiographic imaging; This platform additionally provides collaborative options for resaerchers to improve these models without sharing sensitive clinical data.
Summary?: FeTS is an open-source toolkit aimed at detecting tumor boundary data from patient imaging data. This platform emphasizes data deidentification for securing sharing models between researchers, allowing for collaborative improvements to be made to these models.

Name: Atlas.ti
Subcategories: Images, Pdf, Audio, Video, Geo, Survey Data, Text Import, Social Network Comments, Reference Manager Data, AV Transcripts
Unique Factor: Free trial; specifically works with sentiment analysis and text data analysis.
Data Types (Clean): Images, Pdf, Audio, Video, Geo, Survey Data, Text Import, Social Network Comments, Reference Manager Data, AV Transcripts
Summary?: ATLAS.ti is a qualitative analysis platform that works with several data types such as video, audio, images, surveys, and social media data. There are also several tools such as text data analysis used for sentiment analysis and named-entity recognition.
